Apply an extrusion (extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.125, extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0, sketch\\_scale: 0.75) through the normal direction. 2. Perform the "New Body" boolean operation. The resulting part should have dimensions: length: 0.75, width: 0.125, and height: 0.25. Part 2: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Slightly Tapered Shape Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered shape, with the narrowest point at the top. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.375, 0.0]. Sketch: 1. Create a face (face\\_1) and a loop (loop\\_1) within the face. 2. Remember that these instructions must be followed strictly in order to create the correct three-dimensional models.</description>
